request.doc: Additional request parameters to restrict the query.
request.name: request

getReferenceBases.doc:
Lists `GAReference` bases by ID and optional range.
`GET /references/{id}/bases` will return a JSON version of
`GAListReferenceBasesResponse`.

getReference.doc:
Gets a `GAReference` by ID.
`GET /references/{id}` will return a JSON version of `GAReference`.

request.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /reads/search` as JSON.
request.name: request

searchReads.doc:
Gets a list of `GAReadAlignment` matching the search criteria.

`POST /reads/search` must accept a JSON version of `GASearchReadsRequest` as
the post body and will return a JSON version of `GASearchReadsResponse`.

request.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /readgroupsets/search` as JSON.
request.name: request

searchReadGroupSets.doc:
Gets a list of `GAReadGroupSet` matching the search criteria.

`POST /readgroupsets/search` must accept a JSON version of
`GASearchReadGroupSetsRequest` as the post body and will return a JSON
version of `GASearchReadGroupSetsResponse`.

request.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /variantsets/search` as JSON.
request.name: request

searchVariantSets.doc:
Gets a list of `GAVariantSet` matching the search criteria.

  `POST /variantsets/search` must accept a JSON version of
  `GASearchVariantSetsRequest` as the post body and will return a JSON version
  of `GASearchVariantSetsResponse`.

request.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /variants/search` as JSON.
request.name: request

searchVariants.doc:
Gets a list of `GAVariant` matching the search criteria.

`POST /variants/search` must accept a JSON version of `GASearchVariantsRequest`
as the post body and will return a JSON version of `GASearchVariantsResponse`.

request.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /callsets/search` as JSON.
request.name: request

searchCallSets.doc:
Gets a list of `GACallSet` matching the search criteria.

`POST /callsets/search` must accept a JSON version of `GASearchCallSetsRequest`
as the post body and will return a JSON version of `GASearchCallSetsResponse`.

request.doc:
This request maps to the body of `POST /referencesets/search`
    as JSON.
request.name: request

searchReferenceSets.doc:
Gets a list of `GAReferenceSet` matching the search criteria.

`POST /referencesets/search` must accept a JSON version of
`GASearchReferenceSetsRequest` as the post body and will return a JSON
version of `GASearchReferenceSetsResponse`.

getReferenceSet.doc:
Gets a `GAReferenceSet` by ID.
`GET /referencesets/{id}` will return a JSON version of `GAReferenceSet`.

request.doc:
This request maps to the body of `POST /references/search`
    as JSON.
request.name: request

searchReferences.doc:
Gets a list of `GAReference` matching the search criteria.

`POST /references/search` must accept a JSON version of
`GASearchReferencesRequest` as the post body and will return a JSON
version of `GASearchReferencesResponse`.

fields.doc: The error message
fields.name: message

fields.doc: The numerical error code
fields.name: errorCode

types.doc: A general exception type.
types.name: GAException

fields.doc:
The name of the reference (or, more technically, the scaffold) in whatever
  reference set is being used. Does not generally include a "chr" prefix, so for
  example "X" would be used for the X chromosome.
fields.name: referenceName

fields.doc:
The 0-based offset from the start of the forward strand for that reference.
  Genomic positions are non-negative integers less than reference length.
fields.name: position

fields.doc:
A flag to indicate if we are on the forward strand (`false`) or reverse
  strand (`true`).
fields.name: reverseStrand

types.doc:
An abstraction for referring to a genomic position, in relation to some
already known reference. For now, represents a genomic position as a reference
name, a base number on that reference (0-based), and a flag to say if it's the
forward or reverse strand that we're talking about.
types.name: GAPosition

types.doc:
An enum for the different types of CIGAR alignment operations that exist.
Used wherever CIGAR alignments are used. The different enumerated values
have the following usage:

* `ALIGNMENT_MATCH`: An alignment match indicates that a sequence can be
  aligned to the reference without evidence of an INDEL. Unlike the
  `SEQUENCE_MATCH` and `SEQUENCE_MISMATCH` operators, the `ALIGNMENT_MATCH`
  operator does not indicate whether the reference and read sequences are an
  exact match. This operator is equivalent to SAM's `M`.
* `INSERT`: The insert operator indicates that the read contains evidence of
  bases being inserted into the reference. This operator is equivalent to
  SAM's `I`.
* `DELETE`: The delete operator indicates that the read contains evidence of
  bases being deleted from the reference. This operator is equivalent to
  SAM's `D`.
* `SKIP`: The skip operator indicates that this read skips a long segment of
  the reference, but the bases have not been deleted. This operator is
  commonly used when working with RNA-seq data, where reads may skip long
  segments of the reference between exons. This operator is equivalent to
  SAM's 'N'.
* `CLIP_SOFT`: The soft clip operator indicates that bases at the start/end
  of a read have not been considered during alignment. This may occur if the
  majority of a read maps, except for low quality bases at the start/end of
  a read. This operator is equivalent to SAM's 'S'. Bases that are soft clipped
  will still be stored in the read.
* `CLIP_HARD`: The hard clip operator indicates that bases at the start/end of
  a read have been omitted from this alignment. This may occur if this linear
  alignment is part of a chimeric alignment, or if the read has been trimmed
  (e.g., during error correction, or to trim poly-A tails for RNA-seq). This
  operator is equivalent to SAM's 'H'.
* `PAD`: The pad operator indicates that there is padding in an alignment.
  This operator is equivalent to SAM's 'P'.
* `SEQUENCE_MATCH`: This operator indicates that this portion of the aligned
  sequence exactly matches the reference (e.g., all bases are equal to the
  reference bases). This operator is equivalent to SAM's '='.
* `SEQUENCE_MISMATCH`: This operator indicates that this portion of the
  aligned sequence is an alignment match to the reference, but a sequence
  mismatch (e.g., the bases are not equal to the reference). This can
  indicate a SNP or a read error. This operator is equivalent to SAM's 'X'.
types.name: GACigarOperation

fields.doc: The operation type.
fields.name: operation

fields.doc: The number of bases that the operation runs for.
fields.name: operationLength

fields.doc:
`referenceSequence` is only used at mismatches (`SEQUENCE_MISMATCH`)
  and deletions (`DELETE`). Filling this field replaces the MD tag.
  If the relevant information is not available, leave this field as `null`.
fields.name: referenceSequence

types.doc: A structure for an instance of a CIGAR operation.
types.name: GACigarUnit

fields.doc: The command line used to run this program.
fields.name: commandLine

fields.doc: The user specified ID of the program.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The name of the program.
fields.name: name

fields.doc: The ID of the program run before this one.
fields.name: prevProgramId

fields.doc: The version of the program run.
fields.name: version

fields.doc: The dataset ID.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The dataset description.
fields.name: description

fields.doc: The library used as part of this experiment.
fields.name: libraryId

fields.doc: The platform unit used as part of this experiment.
fields.name: platformUnit

fields.doc: The sequencing center used as part of this experiment.
fields.name: sequencingCenter

fields.doc:
The instrument model used as part of this experiment.
  This maps to sequencing technology in BAM.
fields.name: instrumentModel

fields.doc: The read group ID.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The ID of the dataset this read group belongs to.
fields.name: datasetId

fields.doc: The read group name.
fields.name: name

fields.doc: The read group description.
fields.name: description

fields.doc: The sample this read group's data was generated from.
fields.name: sampleId

fields.doc: The experiment used to generate this read group.
fields.name: experiment

fields.doc: The predicted insert size of this read group.
fields.name: predictedInsertSize

fields.doc: The time at which this read group was created in milliseconds from the epoch.
fields.name: created

fields.doc:
The time at which this read group was last updated in milliseconds
  from the epoch.
fields.name: updated

fields.doc: The programs used to generate this read group.
fields.name: programs

fields.doc:
The reference set the reads in this read group are aligned to.
  Required if there are any read alignments.
fields.name: referenceSetId

fields.doc: A map of additional read group information.
fields.name: info

fields.doc: The read group set ID.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The ID of the dataset this read group set belongs to.
fields.name: datasetId

fields.doc: The read group set name.
fields.name: name

fields.doc: The read groups in this set.
fields.name: readGroups

fields.doc: The position of this alignment.
fields.name: position

fields.doc:
The mapping quality of this alignment. Represents how likely
  the read maps to this position as opposed to other locations.
fields.name: mappingQuality

fields.doc:
Represents the local alignment of this sequence (alignment matches, indels, etc)
  versus the reference.
fields.name: cigar

types.doc: A linear alignment can be represented by one CIGAR string.
types.name: GALinearAlignment

fields.doc:
The read alignment ID. This ID is unique within the read group this
  alignment belongs to. This field may not be provided by all backends.
  Its intended use is to make caching and UI display easier for
  genome browsers and other light weight clients.
fields.name: id

fields.doc:
The ID of the read group this read belongs to.
  (Every read must belong to exactly one read group.)
fields.name: readGroupId

fields.doc: The fragment name. Equivalent to QNAME (query template name) in SAM.
fields.name: fragmentName

fields.doc:
The orientation and the distance between reads from the fragment are
  consistent with the sequencing protocol (extension to SAM flag 0x2)
fields.name: properPlacement

fields.doc: The fragment is a PCR or optical duplicate (SAM flag 0x400)
fields.name: duplicateFragment

fields.doc: The number of reads in the fragment (extension to SAM flag 0x1)
fields.name: numberReads

fields.doc: The observed length of the fragment, equivalent to TLEN in SAM.
fields.name: fragmentLength

fields.doc:
The read number in sequencing. 0-based and less than numberReads. This field
  replaces SAM flag 0x40 and 0x80.
fields.name: readNumber

fields.doc: SAM flag 0x200
fields.name: failedVendorQualityChecks

fields.doc:
The linear alignment for this alignment record. This field will be
  null if the read is unmapped.
fields.name: alignment

fields.doc:
Whether this alignment is secondary. Equivalent to SAM flag 0x100.
  A secondary alignment represents an alternative to the primary alignment
  for this read. Aligners may return secondary alignments if a read can map
  ambiguously to multiple coordinates in the genome.

  By convention, each read has one and only one alignment where both
  secondaryAlignment and supplementaryAlignment are false.
fields.name: secondaryAlignment

fields.doc:
Whether this alignment is supplementary. Equivalent to SAM flag 0x800.
  Supplementary alignments are used in the representation of a chimeric
  alignment. In a chimeric alignment, a read is split into multiple
  linear alignments that map to different reference contigs. The first
  linear alignment in the read will be designated as the representative alignment;
  the remaining linear alignments will be designated as supplementary alignments.
  These alignments may have different mapping quality scores.

  In each linear alignment in a chimeric alignment, the read will be hard clipped.
  The `alignedSequence` and `alignedQuality` fields in the alignment record will
  only represent the bases for its respective linear alignment.
fields.name: supplementaryAlignment

fields.doc:
The bases of the read sequence contained in this alignment record.
  `alignedSequence` and `alignedQuality` may be shorter than the full read sequence
  and quality. This will occur if the alignment is part of a chimeric alignment,
  or if the read was trimmed. When this occurs, the CIGAR for this read will
  begin/end with a hard clip operator that will indicate the length of the excised sequence.
fields.name: alignedSequence

fields.doc:
The quality of the read sequence contained in this alignment record.
  `alignedSequence` and `alignedQuality` may be shorter than the full read sequence
  and quality. This will occur if the alignment is part of a chimeric alignment,
  or if the read was trimmed. When this occurs, the CIGAR for this read will
  begin/end with a hard clip operator that will indicate the length of the excised sequence.
fields.name: alignedQuality

fields.doc:
The mapping of the primary alignment of the `(readNumber+1)%numberReads`
  read in the fragment. It replaces mate position and mate strand in SAM.
fields.name: nextMatePosition

fields.doc: A map of additional read alignment information.
fields.name: info

types.doc:
Each read alignment describes a linear alignment with additional information
about the fragment and the read. A read alignment object is equivalent to a
line in a SAM file.
types.name: GAReadAlignment

fields.doc: If specified, restrict this query to reads within the given readgroups.
fields.name: readGroupIds

fields.doc:
The reference to query. Provide at most one of `referenceId` and
  `referenceName`. Leaving both blank returns results from all references,
  including unmapped reads - this could be very large.
fields.name: referenceName

fields.doc:
The reference to query. Provide at most one of `referenceId` and
  `referenceName`. Leaving both blank returns results from all
  references, including unmapped reads - this could be very large.
fields.name: referenceId

fields.doc:
The start position (0-based) of this query.
  If a reference is specified, this defaults to 0.
  Genomic positions are non-negative integers less than reference length.
  Requests spanning the join of circular genomes are represented as 
  two requests one on each side of the join (position 0).
fields.name: start

fields.doc:
The end position (0-based, exclusive) of this query.
  If a reference is specified, this defaults to the
  reference's length.
fields.name: end

fields.doc:
Specifies the maximum number of results to return in a single page.
  If unspecified, a system default will be used.
fields.name: pageSize

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of
  `nextPageToken` from the previous response.
fields.name: pageToken

types.doc:
This request maps to the body of `POST /reads/search` as JSON.

If a reference is specified, all queried `GAReadGroup`s must be aligned
to `GAReferenceSet`s containing that same `GAReference`. If no reference is
specified, all `GAReadGroup`s must be aligned to the same `GAReferenceSet`.
types.name: GASearchReadsRequest

fields.doc:
The list of matching alignment records, sorted by position.
  Unmapped reads, which have no position, are returned last.
fields.name: alignments

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of
  results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.
fields.name: nextPageToken

types.doc: This is the response from `POST /reads/search` expressed as JSON.
types.name: GASearchReadsResponse

fields.doc: The list of datasets to search.
fields.name: datasetIds

fields.doc:
Only return read group sets for which a substring of the name matches
  this string.
fields.name: name

fields.doc:
Specifies the maximum number of results to return in a single page.
  If unspecified, a system default will be used.
fields.name: pageSize

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of
  `nextPageToken` from the previous response.
fields.name: pageToken

types.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /readgroupsets/search` as JSON.
types.name: GASearchReadGroupSetsRequest

fields.doc: The list of matching read group sets.
fields.name: readGroupSets

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of
  results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.
fields.name: nextPageToken

types.doc: This is the response from `POST /readgroupsets/search` expressed as JSON.
types.name: GASearchReadGroupSetsResponse

fields.doc: The top-level key.
fields.name: key

fields.doc: The value field for simple metadata.
fields.name: value

fields.doc:
User-provided ID field, not enforced by this API.
  Two or more pieces of structured metadata with identical
  id and key fields are considered equivalent.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The type of data.
fields.name: type

fields.doc:
The number of values that can be included in a field described by this
  metadata.
fields.name: number

fields.doc: A textual description of this metadata.
fields.name: description

fields.doc: Remaining structured metadata key-value pairs.
fields.name: info

types.doc: This metadata represents VCF header information.
types.name: GAVariantSetMetadata

fields.doc: The variant set ID.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The ID of the dataset this variant set belongs to.
fields.name: datasetId

fields.doc:
The metadata associated with this variant set. This is equivalent to
  the VCF header information not already presented in first class fields.
fields.name: metadata

types.doc:
`GAVariant` and `GACallSet` both belong to a `GAVariantSet`.
`GAVariantSet` belongs to a `GADataset`.
The variant set is equivalent to a VCF file.
types.name: GAVariantSet

fields.doc: The call set ID.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The call set name.
fields.name: name

fields.doc: The sample this call set's data was generated from.
fields.name: sampleId

fields.doc: The IDs of the variant sets this call set has calls in.
fields.name: variantSetIds

fields.doc: The date this call set was created in milliseconds from the epoch.
fields.name: created

fields.doc:
The time at which this call set was last updated in
  milliseconds from the epoch.
fields.name: updated

fields.doc: A map of additional call set information.
fields.name: info

types.doc:
A `GACallSet` is a collection of variant calls for a particular sample.
It belongs to a `GAVariantSet`. This is equivalent to one column in VCF.
types.name: GACallSet

fields.doc:
The ID of the call set this variant call belongs to.
  If this field is not present, the ordering of the call sets from a
  `SearchCallSetsRequest` over this `GAVariantSet` is guaranteed to match
  the ordering of the calls on this `GAVariant`.
  The number of results will also be the same.
fields.name: callSetId

fields.doc:
The name of the call set this variant call belongs to.
  If this field is not present, the ordering of the call sets from a
  `SearchCallSetsRequest` over this `GAVariantSet` is guaranteed to match
  the ordering of the calls on this `GAVariant`.
  The number of results will also be the same.
fields.name: callSetName

fields.doc:
The genotype of this variant call. Each value represents either the value
  of the referenceBases field or is a 1-based index into alternateBases.
  If a variant had a referenceBases field of "T", an alternateBases
  value of ["A", "C"], and the genotype was [2, 1], that would mean the call
  represented the heterozygous value "CA" for this variant. If the genotype
  was instead [0, 1] the represented value would be "TA". Ordering of the
  genotype values is important if the phaseset field is present.
fields.name: genotype

fields.doc:
If this field is present, this variant call's genotype ordering implies
  the phase of the bases and is consistent with any other variant calls on
  the same contig which have the same phaseset value.
fields.name: phaseset

fields.doc:
The genotype likelihoods for this variant call. Each array entry
  represents how likely a specific genotype is for this call. The value
  ordering is defined by the GL tag in the VCF spec.
fields.name: genotypeLikelihood

fields.doc: A map of additional variant call information.
fields.name: info

types.doc:
A `GACall` represents the determination of genotype with respect to a
particular variant. It may include associated information such as quality
and phasing. For example, a call might assign a probability of 0.32 to
the occurrence of a SNP named rs1234 in a call set with the name NA12345.
types.name: GACall

fields.doc: The variant ID.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The ID of the variant set this variant belongs to.
fields.name: variantSetId

fields.doc: Names for the variant, for example a RefSNP ID.
fields.name: names

fields.doc: The date this variant was created in milliseconds from the epoch.
fields.name: created

fields.doc:
The time at which this variant was last updated in
  milliseconds from the epoch.
fields.name: updated

fields.doc:
The reference on which this variant occurs.
  (e.g. `chr20` or `X`)
fields.name: referenceName

fields.doc:
The start position at which this variant occurs (0-based).
  This corresponds to the first base of the string of reference bases.
  Genomic positions are non-negative integers less than reference length.
  Variants spanning the join of circular genomes are represented as
  two variants one on each side of the join (position 0).
fields.name: start

fields.doc:
The end position (exclusive), resulting in [start, end) closed-open interval.
  This is typically calculated by `start + referenceBases.length`.
fields.name: end

fields.doc: The reference bases for this variant. They start at the given position.
fields.name: referenceBases

fields.doc: The bases that appear instead of the reference bases.
fields.name: alternateBases

fields.doc: A map of additional variant information.
fields.name: info

fields.doc:
The variant calls for this particular variant. Each one represents the
  determination of genotype with respect to this variant.
fields.name: calls

types.doc:
A `GAVariant` represents a change in DNA sequence relative to some reference.
For example, a variant could represent a SNP or an insertion.
Variants belong to a `GAVariantSet`.
This is equivalent to a row in VCF.
types.name: GAVariant

fields.doc:
If specified, will restrict the query to variant sets within the
    given datasets.
fields.name: datasetIds

fields.doc:
Specifies the maximum number of results to return in a single page. 
    If unspecified, a system default will be used.
fields.name: pageSize

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
    To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of
    `nextPageToken` from the previous response.
fields.name: pageToken

types.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /variantsets/search` as JSON.
types.name: GASearchVariantSetsRequest

fields.doc: The list of matching variant sets.
fields.name: variantSets

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
    Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of
    results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.
fields.name: nextPageToken

types.doc: This is the response from `POST /variantsets/search` expressed as JSON.
types.name: GASearchVariantSetsResponse

fields.doc: Required. The IDs of the variant sets to search over.
fields.name: variantSetIds

fields.doc: Only return variants which have exactly this name.
fields.name: variantName

fields.doc:
Only return variant calls which belong to call sets with these IDs.
  Leaving this blank returns all variant calls.
fields.name: callSetIds

fields.doc: Required. Only return variants on this reference.
fields.name: referenceName

fields.doc:
Required. The beginning of the window (0-based, inclusive) for
  which overlapping variants should be returned.
  Genomic positions are non-negative integers less than reference length.
  Requests spanning the join of circular genomes are represented as
  two requests one on each side of the join (position 0).
fields.name: start

fields.doc:
Required. The end of the window (0-based, exclusive) for which overlapping
  variants should be returned.
fields.name: end

fields.doc:
Specifies the maximum number of results to return in a single page.
  If unspecified, a system default will be used.
fields.name: pageSize

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of
  `nextPageToken` from the previous response.
fields.name: pageToken

types.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /variants/search` as JSON.
types.name: GASearchVariantsRequest

fields.doc:
The list of matching variants.
  If the `callSetId` field on the returned calls is not present,
  the ordering of the call sets from a `SearchCallSetsRequest`
  over the parent `GAVariantSet` is guaranteed to match the ordering
  of the calls on each `GAVariant`. The number of results will also be
  the same.
fields.name: variants

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of
  results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.
fields.name: nextPageToken

types.doc: This is the response from `POST /variants/search` expressed as JSON.
types.name: GASearchVariantsResponse

fields.doc:
If specified, will restrict the query to call sets within the
  given variant sets.
fields.name: variantSetIds

fields.doc:
Only return call sets for which a substring of the name matches this
  string.
fields.name: name

fields.doc:
Specifies the maximum number of results to return in a single page.
  If unspecified, a system default will be used.
fields.name: pageSize

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of
  `nextPageToken` from the previous response.
fields.name: pageToken

types.doc: This request maps to the body of `POST /callsets/search` as JSON.
types.name: GASearchCallSetsRequest

fields.doc: The list of matching call sets.
fields.name: callSets

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of
  results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.
fields.name: nextPageToken

types.doc: This is the response from `POST /callsets/search` expressed as JSON.
types.name: GASearchCallSetsResponse

fields.doc: The reference ID. Unique within the repository.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The length of this reference's sequence.
fields.name: length

fields.doc:
MD5 of the upper-case sequence excluding all whitespace characters
  (this is equivalent to SQ:M5 in SAM).
fields.name: md5checksum

fields.doc:
The name of this reference. (e.g. '22') Also see the
  `names` field on the parent `GAReferenceSet`.
fields.name: name

fields.doc:
The URI from which the sequence was obtained.
  Specifies a FASTA format file/string with one name, sequence pair.
fields.name: sourceURI

fields.doc:
All known corresponding accession IDs in INSDC (GenBank/ENA/DDBJ) ideally
  with a version number, e.g. `GCF_000001405.26`.
fields.name: sourceAccessions

fields.doc:
A sequence X is said to be derived from source sequence Y, if X and Y
  are of the same length and the per-base sequence divergence at A/C/G/T bases
  is sufficiently small. Two sequences derived from the same official
  sequence share the same coordinates and annotations, and
  can be replaced with the official sequence for certain use cases.
fields.name: isDerived

fields.doc:
The `sourceDivergence` is the fraction of non-indel bases that do not match the
  reference this record was derived from.
fields.name: sourceDivergence

fields.doc: ID from http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy (e.g. 9606->human).
fields.name: ncbiTaxonId

types.doc:
A `GAReference` is a canonical assembled contig, intended to act as a
reference coordinate space for other genomic annotations. A single
`GAReference` might represent the human chromosome 1, for instance.
types.name: GAReference

fields.doc: The reference set ID. Unique in the repository.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: The IDs of the `GAReference` objects that are part of this set.
fields.name: referenceIds

fields.doc:
Order-independent MD5 checksum which identifies this `GAReferenceSet`. The
  checksum is computed by sorting all `reference.md5checksum` (for all
  `reference` in this set) in ascending lexicographic order, concatenating,
  and taking the MD5 of that value.
fields.name: md5checksum

fields.doc:
ID from http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy (e.g. 9606->human) indicating
  the species which this assembly is intended to model. Note that contained
  `GAReference`s may specify a different `ncbiTaxonId`, as assemblies may
  contain reference sequences which do not belong to the modeled species, e.g.
  EBV in a human reference genome.
fields.name: ncbiTaxonId

fields.doc: Optional free text description of this reference set.
fields.name: description

fields.doc: Public id of this reference set, such as `GRCh37`.
fields.name: assemblyId

fields.doc: Specifies a FASTA format file/string.
fields.name: sourceURI

fields.doc:
All known corresponding accession IDs in INSDC (GenBank/ENA/DDBJ) ideally
  with a version number, e.g. `NC_000001.11`.
fields.name: sourceAccessions

fields.doc:
A reference set may be derived from a source if it contains
  additional sequences, or some of the sequences within it are derived
  (see the definition of `isDerived` in `GAReference`).
fields.name: isDerived

types.doc:
A `GAReferenceSet` is a set of `GAReference`s which typically comprise a
reference assembly, such as `GRCh38`. A `GAReferenceSet` defines a common
coordinate space for comparing reference-aligned experimental data.
types.name: GAReferenceSet

fields.doc:
If present, return the reference sets which match any of the given
  `md5checksum`s. See `GAReferenceSet::md5checksum` for details.
fields.name: md5checksums

fields.doc:
If present, return reference sets for which the accession
  matches this string. Best to give a version number (e.g. `GCF_000001405.26`).
  If only the main accession number is given then all records with
  that main accession will be returned, whichever version.
  Note that different versions will have different sequences.
fields.name: accessions

fields.doc:
If present, return reference sets for which the `assemblyId`
  contains this string.
fields.name: assemblyId

fields.doc:
Specifies the maximum number of results to return in a single page.
  If unspecified, a system default will be used.
fields.name: pageSize

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of
  `nextPageToken` from the previous response.
fields.name: pageToken

types.doc:
This request maps to the body of `POST /referencesets/search`
as JSON.
types.name: GASearchReferenceSetsRequest

fields.doc: The list of matching reference sets.
fields.name: referenceSets

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of
  results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.
fields.name: nextPageToken

types.doc:
This is the response from `POST /referencesets/search`
expressed as JSON.
types.name: GASearchReferenceSetsResponse

fields.doc:
If present, return references which match any of the given `md5checksums`.
  See `GAReference::md5checksum` for details.
fields.name: md5checksums

fields.doc:
If present, return references for which the accession
  matches this string. Best to give a version number e.g. `GCF_000001405.26`.
  If only the main accession number is given then all records with
  that main accession will be returned, whichever version.
  Note that different versions will have different sequences.
fields.name: accessions

fields.doc:
Specifies the maximum number of results to return in a single page.
  If unspecified, a system default will be used.
fields.name: pageSize

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of
  `nextPageToken` from the previous response.
fields.name: pageToken

types.doc:
This request maps to the body of `POST /references/search`
as JSON.
types.name: GASearchReferencesRequest

fields.doc: The list of matching references.
fields.name: references

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of
  results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.
fields.name: nextPageToken

types.doc: This is the response from `POST /references/search` expressed as JSON.
types.name: GASearchReferencesResponse

fields.doc:
The start position (0-based) of this query. Defaults to 0.
  Genomic positions are non-negative integers less than reference length.
  Requests spanning the join of circular genomes are represented as
  two requests one on each side of the join (position 0).
fields.name: start

fields.doc:
The end position (0-based, exclusive) of this query. Defaults
  to the length of this `GAReference`.
fields.name: end

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of
  `nextPageToken` from the previous response.
fields.name: pageToken

types.doc:
The query parameters for a request to `GET /references/{id}/bases`, for
example:

`GET /references/{id}/bases?start=100&end=200`
types.name: GAListReferenceBasesRequest

fields.doc:
The offset position (0-based) of the given `sequence` from the start of this
  `GAReference`. This value will differ for each page in a paginated request.
fields.name: offset

fields.doc:
A substring of the bases that make up this reference. Bases are represented
  as IUPAC-IUB codes; this string matches the regexp `[ACGTMRWSYKVHDBN]*`.
fields.name: sequence

fields.doc:
The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets.
  Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of
  results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.
fields.name: nextPageToken

types.doc: The response from `GET /references/{id}/bases` expressed as JSON.
types.name: GAListReferenceBasesResponse
